intro: Meconopsis paniculata var. rubra, commonly known as the red Himalayan poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking red to orange-pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and grows in rocky, alpine environments. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppies. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
